name: Image
description: The `Image` class is a powerful rendering component for displaying images in JSMacros 2D rendering contexts. It provides comprehensive control over image positioning, sizing, coloring, rotation, and texture region selection.
overview:
The `Image` class is a powerful rendering component for displaying images in JSMacros 2D rendering contexts. It provides comprehensive control over image positioning, sizing, coloring, rotation, and texture region selection. This class is commonly used for creating custom HUDs, overlays, GUI elements, and visual effects in Minecraft scripts.

Image instances can display portions of textures, apply color tints and transparency, support rotation transformations, and can be easily positioned relative to other elements using the built-in alignment system.

constructors.signature: new Image(x, y, width, height, zIndex, color, id, imageX, imageY, regionWidth, regionHeight, textureWidth, textureHeight, rotation)
constructors.description: Creates a new Image with the specified properties.

parameters.name: imageX
parameters.description: X coordinate in texture to start from

parameters.name: imageY
parameters.description: Y coordinate in texture to start from

parameters.name: regionWidth
parameters.description: Width of the region in texture to use

parameters.name: regionHeight
parameters.description: Height of the region in texture to use

constructors.signature: new Image(x, y, width, height, zIndex, alpha, color, id, imageX, imageY, regionWidth, regionHeight, textureWidth, textureHeight, rotation)
constructors.description: Creates a new Image with separate alpha and color values.

parameters.name: imageX
parameters.description: X coordinate in texture to start from

parameters.name: imageY
parameters.description: Y coordinate in texture to start from

parameters.name: regionWidth
parameters.description: Width of the region in texture to use

parameters.name: regionHeight
parameters.description: Height of the region in texture to use

methods.name: pos
methods.description: Sets the X and Y position of the image during the builder configuration.

methods.name: size
methods.description: Sets the rendering width and height of the image during the builder configuration.

methods.name: regions
methods.signature: regions(imageX: number, imageY: number, regionWidth: number, regionHeight: number): Image.Builder
methods.description: Sets the texture region to use within the source texture during the builder configuration.

parameters.name: imageX
parameters.description: X coordinate in texture to start from.

parameters.name: imageY
parameters.description: Y coordinate in texture to start from.

parameters.name: regionWidth
parameters.description: Width of the region in texture to use.

parameters.name: regionHeight
parameters.description: Height of the region in texture to use.

methods.name: color
methods.description: Sets the RGB color tint for the image during the builder configuration.

methods.name: alpha
methods.description: Sets the alpha transparency for the image during the builder configuration.

methods.name: rotation
methods.description: Sets the rotation angle for the image during the builder configuration.

methods.name: zIndex
methods.description: Sets the Z-order depth for rendering during the builder configuration.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Constructs and returns a new Image instance from the builder's current configuration.

methods.name: setRotation
methods.description: Sets the rotation angle of an already created Image instance.

methods.name: setSize
methods.description: Sets the rendering width and height of an already created Image instance.

methods.name: setPos
methods.description: Sets the X and Y position of an already created Image instance.

methods.name: align
methods.description: Sets the alignment of the image relative to its parent container during the builder configuration.

methods.name: fromCustomImage
methods.description: Configures the image to use a CustomImage object, automatically setting its dimensions and regions based on the custom image's properties, via the builder.

parameters.name: customImage
parameters.description: The custom image object to use.
